lead_paragraph: AS the demand for boating slips declines, Southern California marina operators are locked in a rent struggle with their landlords, the local government agencies owning tidelands and bayfronts. H. P. Purdon, owner of the Shelter Cove Marina on San Diego Bay, is facing a possible rent increase, even though, he says, his slips are typically at least 15 percent empty. The San Diego Unified Port District, which controls San Diego Bay, is now having all of its marina properties appraised.
abstract: Southern California marinas, facing drop in demand for boating slips, are locked in rent struggles with their landlords, local government agencies owning tidelands and bayfronts; building of new marinas has almost completely ceased in area; photos (M)

headline.main: Marinas in Southern California Battle Landlords
